restaurant.name: The Himalayan House
restaurant.address: 123 mountain view ave, brooklyn, new york, ny 11201
restaurant.description: a small, cozy nepali and himalayan inspired restaurant focused on simple, warming comfort food like dal bhat, momos, and noodle soups.
restaurant.seating_summary: we have indoor seating for about 50 guests, with a mix of tables for two, four, and a few larger tables for groups.
restaurant.fun_fact: the himalayan house is inspired by small family kitchens in kathmandu and foothill villages, focusing on simple, warming dishes like dal bhat and thukpa.

chefs.name: suman gurung
chefs.bio: chef suman grew up in eastern nepal and has worked in nepali and indian kitchens in new york for several years.

chefs.name: asha lama
chefs.bio: chef asha focuses on soups, stir fries, and snacks, bringing homestyle flavors to the menu.

restaurant.chefs_summary: our dishes are prepared by a small team of nepali and himalayan chefs, led by head chef suman gurung and sous chef asha lama. they focus on comforting, balanced flavors inspired by home cooking.
restaurant.owner_info: the restaurant is independently owned and operated by a local family. if you need the owner’s name for something specific, please ask a staff member directly.

hours.summary: we are open sunday through thursday from 11:00 am to 10:00 pm, and friday and saturday from 11:00 am to 11:00 pm.

policies.reservations: we accept reservations for parties of four or more. smaller groups are welcome as walk-ins, subject to table availability.
policies.refunds: since we are a small restaurant, all food sales are final once served. if there is an issue with your order, please speak to a staff member during your visit.
policies.delivery: we currently offer takeout and pickup for all main dishes, but we do not provide third-party delivery.
policies.catering: we offer catering for events of roughly 10 to 150 guests. please call or email us for menu options and pricing.
policies.cancellation: for reservations of eight or more, we ask that you contact us at least 24 hours in advance if you need to cancel or change the time.

dietary.halal_status: we are not a halal-certified restaurant. some guests who eat halal may still find suitable options, but we cannot guarantee halal preparation.
dietary.vegan_note: some dishes can be made vegan, such as veg momos, fried rice with vegetables, dal bhat without ghee, and thukpa with vegetables. please let the staff know your preferences.
dietary.gluten_note: our kitchen uses wheat products and we cannot guarantee a completely gluten free meal. some rice-based dishes avoid wheat ingredients, but cross contact is possible.
dietary.dairy_note: several dishes contain dairy such as yogurt or ghee. some items can be prepared with less or no dairy on request, but we do not have a fully dairy free kitchen.
dietary.nut_note: some items may come into contact with nuts in the kitchen, so we cannot guarantee that any dish is completely nut free.

momos.name: momos
momos.description: traditional nepali dumplings, served steamed or lightly pan fried, with tomato and sesame achar on the side.

chow_mein.name: chow mein
chow_mein.description: nepali style stir fried wheat noodles with cabbage, bell peppers, onion, and scallions.

fried_rice.name: fried rice
fried_rice.description: wok fried rice with peas, carrots, scallions, garlic, and ginger. can be served plain, with egg, or with added chicken or beef.

dal_bhat.name: dal bhat
dal_bhat.description: classic nepali plate with lentil soup, steamed rice, seasonal vegetables, pickles, and a small side of greens.

himalayan_curry.name: himalayan curry
himalayan_curry.description: slow simmered curry made with onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, coriander, turmeric, cumin, and mild chili. available with vegetables or meat and served with rice.

thukpa.name: thukpa
thukpa.description: nepali noodle soup with broth, wheat noodles, vegetables, and optional meat.

veg_samosa.name: vegetable samosas
veg_samosa.description: crispy pastry filled with spiced potatoes and peas, served with chutney.

masala_fries.name: masala fries
masala_fries.description: crisp fries tossed with house masala spice blend.

faq.menu_overview: we serve nepali and himalayan inspired comfort food, including different types of momos, chow mein, fried rice, dal bhat, himalayan curry, thukpa (noodle soup), snacks like vegetable samosas and masala fries, and traditional drinks.
faq.popular_items: our most popular dishes are chicken momos, veg chow mein, dal bhat, and himalayan curry. guests also love thukpa noodle soup on colder days.
faq.desserts: we offer a small rotating selection of nepali inspired desserts such as kheer (rice pudding) and sweet sel roti on some days. availability may vary.
faq.vegan_options: some dishes can be made vegan, such as veg momos, fried rice with vegetables, dal bhat without ghee, thukpa with vegetables, and masala fries. please let the staff know your preferences.
faq.vegetarian_options: we have several vegetarian friendly dishes such as veg momos, chow mein without meat, fried rice with vegetables, dal bhat, thukpa with vegetables, vegetable samosas, and masala fries.
faq.gluten_info: our kitchen uses wheat products and we cannot guarantee a completely gluten free meal. some rice-based dishes like dal bhat and himalayan curry with rice avoid wheat ingredients, but cross contact is possible.
faq.dairy_info: several dishes contain dairy such as yogurt or ghee. some items can be prepared with less or no dairy on request, but we do not have a fully dairy free kitchen.
faq.nut_allergy_info: some items may come into contact with nuts in the kitchen, so we cannot guarantee that any dish is completely nut free.
faq.drinks_overview: we serve masala chai, himalayan spiced tea, lassi, soft drinks, and still or sparkling water.
faq.story_note: the himalayan house aims to bring a bit of nepali and himalayan home cooking to a casual, cozy space in brooklyn.

price_info.drinks_price_range: most non-alcoholic drinks are between $3 and $6.
price_info.note: among main dishes, masala fries and vegetable samosas are usually the least expensive items, while himalayan curry is among the higher priced mains.
